practice_questions.title: JavaScript Variable Scopes
practice_questions.description: Questions about the differences between var, let, and const in JavaScript.
practice_questions.prompt: Which statement about JavaScript variable declarations is correct?
multiChoiceAnswers: Variables declared with let have block scope.

practice_questions.title: HTTP Status Codes
practice_questions.description: Understanding of common HTTP status codes and their meaning.
practice_questions.prompt: Explain the difference between HTTP 200, 404, and 500 status codes.
practice_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Look for correct explanations of each code and their typical use cases.

companies.name: Google
companies.description: Global technology company specializing in Internet services.

openReferenceAnswers.text: HTTP 200 means OK and the request was successful. 404 means Not Found, indicating the resource does not exist. 500 means Internal Server Error, showing a server-side problem.
200: success, 404: client error for missing resource, 500: generic server failure.

practice_questions.title: CSS Flexbox Direction
practice_questions.description: Test understanding of the default flexbox direction property.
practice_questions.prompt: In CSS Flexbox, the default value of the flex-direction property is 'row'. True or false?
practice_questions.trueFalseExplanation: The flex-direction property defaults to 'row', so flex items are placed in a row by default.

practice_questions.title: SQL Join Types
practice_questions.description: Match SQL join types to their correct descriptions.
practice_questions.prompt: Match each SQL join type with its description.

matchingPairs.right: Returns only matching rows from both tables.
matchingPairs.explanation: INNER JOIN returns records with matching values in both tables.

matchingPairs.right: Returns all rows from the left table and matching rows from the right.
matchingPairs.explanation: LEFT JOIN returns all records from the left table, and the matched records from the right.

matchingPairs.right: Returns all rows from the right table and matching rows from the left.
matchingPairs.explanation: RIGHT JOIN returns all records from the right table, and the matched records from the left.

matchingPairs.right: Returns all rows when there is a match in either table.
matchingPairs.explanation: FULL OUTER JOIN returns all records when there is a match in either left or right table.

practice_questions.title: Design a URL Shortener Service
practice_questions.description: Evaluate ability to design a scalable and robust URL shortener like bit.ly.
practice_questions.prompt: Design a system for a URL shortener service that supports billions of URLs and high availability.
practice_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Look for discussion of unique code generation, data storage, read/write patterns, high availability, and scaling.

openReferenceAnswers.text: Discuss database sharding, unique code generation, caching, replication, and handling redirection.

practice_questions.title: React useEffect Hook
practice_questions.description: Tests knowledge of how useEffect works in React functional components.
practice_questions.prompt: When does the function passed to the useEffect hook in React run by default?

practice_questions.title: Eventual Consistency vs Strong Consistency
practice_questions.description: Assesses understanding of consistency models in distributed systems.
practice_questions.prompt: Compare eventual consistency and strong consistency in distributed systems. Give examples where each is appropriate.
practice_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Look for correct definitions, trade-offs, and realistic scenarios.

companies.name: Amazon
companies.description: Global e-commerce and cloud computing company.

openReferenceAnswers.text: Eventual consistency allows data to become consistent over time. Strong consistency requires all reads to see the latest write. Eventual consistency is used in systems like DNS or S3; strong consistency in banking systems.

practice_questions.title: DevOps Tools and Their Use Cases
practice_questions.description: Match DevOps tools to their primary use.
practice_questions.prompt: Match each DevOps tool to its primary use case.

matchingPairs.explanation: Jenkins automates building and testing code.
Terraform manages infrastructure via configuration files.
Kubernetes manages deployment and scaling of containers.

practice_questions.title: SQL Indexes and Performance
practice_questions.description: Checks understanding of the impact of indexes on SQL query performance.
practice_questions.prompt: Adding an index to a table always improves the performance of all queries on that table. True or false?
practice_questions.trueFalseExplanation: Indexes improve SELECT query performance but can slow down INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations.

practice_questions.title: TCP vs UDP Characteristics
practice_questions.description: Analyzes understanding of the core differences between TCP and UDP protocols.
practice_questions.prompt: Which of the following statements about TCP and UDP is correct?
multiChoiceAnswers: TCP is connection-oriented, while UDP is connectionless.

practice_mcq_options.text: Variables declared with var are block scoped.
practice_mcq_options.explanation: var is function scoped, not block scoped.

practice_mcq_options.text: Variables declared with let have block scope.

practice_mcq_options.explanation: const variables cannot be reassigned after their initial assignment.

practice_mcq_options.text: var and let have the same scoping rules.
practice_mcq_options.explanation: var is function scoped, let is block scoped.
By default, useEffect runs after every render.
This happens only if the dependency array is empty.
useEffect runs after rendering, not before.
It depends on the dependency array.

practice_mcq_options.text: TCP is connection-oriented, while UDP is connectionless.
practice_mcq_options.explanation: TCP requires a connection; UDP does not.

practice_mcq_options.text: UDP guarantees delivery of packets in order.
practice_mcq_options.explanation: UDP does not guarantee delivery or order.

practice_mcq_options.text: TCP is faster than UDP for real-time data.
practice_mcq_options.explanation: UDP is typically faster for real-time but less reliable.

practice_mcq_options.text: UDP is always preferred for file transfer protocols.
practice_mcq_options.explanation: TCP is preferred for file transfers due to reliability.

practice_matching_pairs.right: Returns only matching rows from both tables.
practice_matching_pairs.explanation: INNER JOIN returns records with matching values in both tables.

practice_matching_pairs.right: Returns all rows from the left table and matching rows from the right.
practice_matching_pairs.explanation: LEFT JOIN returns all records from the left table, and the matched records from the right.

practice_matching_pairs.right: Returns all rows from the right table and matching rows from the left.
practice_matching_pairs.explanation: RIGHT JOIN returns all records from the right table, and the matched records from the left.

practice_matching_pairs.right: Returns all rows when there is a match in either table.
practice_matching_pairs.explanation: FULL OUTER JOIN returns all records when there is a match in either left or right table.
Jenkins automates building and testing code.
Terraform manages infrastructure via configuration files.
Kubernetes manages deployment and scaling of containers.
